album.title: Charly Blues Masterworks, Volume 17: Bright Lights, Big City

track.name: Bright Lights, Big City
comments: great tune, Johhny winter does this with Bonnie Rait...good too.
I spent my pre-teen years grooving to Jimmy Reed albums. Great stuff
waybackmachine Gem
this song got some run on my local r&b station when I was a kid.  I was the only one who liked it   under age 40
go lite,babby!!!!!
Chicago Blues vom Feinsten !!!!!!!!!!
Jimmy Reed.... Use to play college dances up the road a piece. Personally responsible for a small population explosion back then.
bin ganz Deiner Meinung, Horst, ein Großer des Blues !!!!
+++ richtig guter Blues - Stimme, Harmonika + Gitarre, PASST ALLES +++
Classic!
Blues, guitar, more blues, harmonica, blues everywhere. Love this song many blues singers have done this  song.
jimmy ---he is the blues man
As soon as I heard "Bright Lights.." I knew this was the song.
I don't care who whispered the words into his ears or how tall he was...all I know this sound they make it's just GREAT!

What a legacy the man left though, unfortunately that is one of two things we can't stop, getting old !
Great story, reminds me when I saw Bo Diddley in N London , sitting on a stool and having plenty of help but to see the man and sounding good, memories, great stuff.
Blues!  Read below...hilarious!

Saw him at the Starlight Ballroom on Jacksboro Hwy. It was New Years Eve in 1964 or 65. He was higher than a kite...could barely stay up on his stool. His wife or girlfriend stood beside him and appeared to be singing the words in his ear and he repeated them. Still..it was a good show.
classic, always does it to ya just listen to that man sing.
classic blues
WOW!!!!!  Really great song.
